review: So basically we went here this past Sunday because I had a gift card from work.  First off the waitress was great though I forgot what her name was. I had that cherry lime type drink with a little vodka that was pretty good. He ordered the quesadilla (yum btw) and I ordered a cup of clam chowder and the bbq chicken wrap. The soup was okay until my spoon hit mid cup and I was thinking hey a nice big piece of potato. Wrong it was a huge clump of soup mix and I was grossed out so I gave it to the bf. The bbq chicken wrap was good as always and garlic fries refill almost made up for the piece of soup powder in my food. It was an ok experience.

We usually don't come to this Red Robin but since its closer to work, my friends decided to stay local instead of taking the long drive to Topanga. My friends find it funny that I eat from the kids menu, but I wasn't that hungry to eat a big burger.  I am still a child at heart, I don't mind eating from the kids menu and what I love most is seeing peoples reaction when I asked for it.   While we waited for the guys to arrive my friends and I entertained ourselves with the kids menu; it has tic tac toe games, you can draw and all these things to keep the child entertained.  The guys came, one of them didn't know what to eat, he asked what was I eating I said I was eating from the kids menu, he thought it was funny but guess who turned out eating from the kids menu?    I got the pepperoni pizza with fries, it might be a small meal but it fills me up and its less than $6 bucks.  If I want more fries I'll just ask my friends to ask for more, that's one of the things that I love from this place the endless fries! The food is pretty good, the burgers are about $10 each.  The host, and both our waitress and waiter were very nice and very attentive filling up our drinks and just making sure everything was ok. Definitely a place to visit if your at the Northridge mall.  It is either this place or Tommy's that catch my attention to eat while at this mall.  The food court does not have appetizing food.

I am an alumni of CSUN and still live in the area so despite graduating I still go to Red Robin from time to time. This particular review is about today's visit. My roommate and I were hungry and decided to go to Red Robin for lunch. Came in around 2:30-3PM and since we beat the lunch rush, were seated right away. My roommate told me that he goes pretty regularly and apparently the waitress, Kristi must have noticed too. Homeboy got two free refills of his soda -- without even asking! But I guess Kristi thought I was his girlfriend or something because she never gave me a refill until I asked for one. She made verrrrrry frequent stops at our table to "check" on us (aka ogle my roommate). It was hilarious at first because I would answer "yes we are fine" and her smile would fade because I was answering, not my roommate. But after a while it got a bit cumbersome.  So the tall white waitress with the plastic black frame glasses... I guess she'll treat you like shit if you show up with a guy she thinks is attractive!  The food this time around, much like the inappropriate service, was abysmal. My roommate ended up not finishing his meal because he bit into his chicken tenders and it was mushy. I didn't end up finishing my burger as the "special sauce" they put on my bun started to taste funny.  Once we were done with our meal I asked Kristi if I could make an order to-go. Our haplessly-smitten waitress FINALLY got the clue that my roommate and I were definitely not on a date and was super sweet as pie to me, promptly handing me the menu, all smiles and flowers and shit. (no lie). We grabbed the food when it came out (did't take too long and conversations help pass the time) and left. We didn't even leave the parking lot when my roommate turned to me and asked if my stomach was feeling weird. It was. When we got home I gave my boyfriend his food and after he ate his meal, my boyfriend said his stomach hurt too. My roommate ended up puking for a while as we were pretty sure his chicken tenders were undercooked (mentioned earlier: the chicken was mushy). My boyfriend and I also took a few trips to the bathroom. Hmm Red Robin needs to seriously re-train their cooks! 2 stars for the awkward comedy I watched unfold before my eyes between the our lovestruck waitress and my roommate.  I think I'll only go back again to see if she hits on my roommate for shits and giggles. No thank you on the food poisoning, please.

I orginally love Red Robin but I came especially today because I got a $5 off coupon from facebook (LOL) My sister and I ordered the "Freckled Lemonade" (sounds so cute) which was basically a strawberry lemonade. And now usually, american restaurants, appetizers are always too large in portion and pricey so we don't order apps but there was a special box at the bottom of the appetizers menu and it said "single order" for like $3 something.. We ordered the single order of cheese sticks and it came out to be about 5 pieces. It was great :) Tasted awesome too! I ordered the BBQ Whiskey Chicken Burger and since my sister is a pescatarian, she doesn't eat meat. She ordered the Garden Burger ( Ewww..). The burgers were good, well I didn't try her Garden Burger but mine was GOOD:) Did I mention how much I love their fries?! Now usually I don't like fries with "guts" you know... the mashy-ness (if you don't get it... the texture of the potato inside) But!! Red Robin fries are to die for.. (not literally)! If you haven't yet, you have to mix up ketchup and tabasco and dip it! My favorite way to eat fries :) This review is making me want more of those fries :) OH, our server was friendly and quick but.. he didn't take my empty drink but brough me a new one before I asked. Another girl had to come over and ask me if everything tasted good and she took the empty plates and cup. I don't know if it was normal, but i think like 3 different servers came to check up on us O_O ... After I paid, the server came by and dropped off the receipts and gave both of us a free drink coupon!  Nice :)

One of the worst experiences my family and I ever had. After we got seated, not one person made an attempt to greet us, take a drink order or acknowledge our existence. We sat there for nearly 15 minutes looking around for someone to come over and even caught the hostess who seated us as she happened to walk by. She mentioned the situation to a few people who whispered around as if it wasn't their station or problem. We finally got up to leave. As I walked out the door, I asked a lady for one of those review cards they have laying around all the tables and I got the smart ass remark of "here's my card also" This was the General Mgr, Kathy. Well Kathy, here's your review- hope your corporate office gets a hold of it soon.  Pathetic experience!!

I'm confused why I have been here more than once. Typical American restaurant. If you want fried food, why go here? Nothing special about their food. Known for burgers. They are supposed to have good lemonade- but not even fresh squeezed. You will come out feeling fat for sure.

Okay I used to go here a decent amount. But due to work changes I stopped frequenting there. There food used to be pretty good, especially there Boca burgers. However this last time I barely had 3 bites of my burger cause it had been overcooked. The outsides were rubbery and hard. I was so unpleasant. my friend who I came with is vegetarian and a picky eater. She has been running late but knew what she wanted. Sadly it was no longer on the menu and instead of the server who should know the products enough to suggest something only said something about the Boca burger.  Nothing else and just stood there until said that we need another minute. Overall the place has just gone down hill and I left having filled up on water and fries.

Jessica has great attitude. she is very attentive to our needs.  She has good listening ear. She communicates clearly and efficiently.  She is an asset to the company. She will be a good trainer for new employee. She did an excellent  service plus great food for sure will be back again.  I appreciate for hiring quality employee.               Sincerely,         Evangeline De Guzman   From Harbor City

Ain't no party like a Red Robin parrrty. Yo, sign up for Red Robin's birthday burger thing, you get a free burger on your birthday.  Probably the best gift you'll get, not saying that you're necessarily a huge loser but, you know, maybe. And please, everyone, can we all drink more water?!?

I've gone to Red Robin restaurants all over southern California and I've always enjoyed the food, and wait staff, but at this Red Robin is kind of :/ I went there today for lunch and was served food with no silverware. I saw the whites of my waitress' eyes twice throughout the entire meal and the food was ok. I'm on a strict diet at the moment, so I have to be particular while ordering my food now at any restaurant. I asked for the lemonade on the menu that's under 10 calories and I was given the sweet original lemonade. The food at this particular Red Robin is not great and most of people working there do not seem to be in the greatest mood.

Went for a couple of beers & a bite with a co- worker after work on 2/9/2012  We sat at the bar & ordered our adult and the bartender quickly returned with our drinks & menus.  Then apparently the manager sent her on break & left the bar uncovered for about 30 minutes.  No waitstaff nor manager came by to see if we would like to order & no drink orders were being filled.  Essentially the bar was closed while the bartender was on break.  Bizarre in the restaurant biz!!  The food we eventually ordered and ate was good.  The bartender apologized for having to abandon the bar which was certainly not her fault.  I might return because of the convenient location and reasonably good food, but I hope I won't have to be involved in another poor management decision.

Went for brunch this week. As the only vegetarian in the group I was a little hard pressed to find something I could eat so I opted for the little dinner salad. My b/f got a turkey BLT and it came on a croissant (it looked really good), the others had fish and chips and it looked good. I snuck a fry and it was tasty. It is not my favorite place, but if you like this kind of food or have kids it is probably 4 stars.
Gluten Free Buns!!! So amazing that they have gluten free buns now. I can finally order burgers and sandwiches and not have to deal with them wrapped in lettuce. :)

My first time here was a couple weeks ago. Decided to go in after a few hours of shopping.  Opted for a burger while my bf had a salad. Both were amazing! I got to say their hamburgers are really great. Not to mention the fries. I probably had 2 baskets myself!!!! (Guilty) Definitely will be going back to try other burgers :) The decor is pretty amazing have something to stare at in every corner. Till next time Red Robin!

I love coming to Red Robin for its sports bar atmosphere and good food. It's also a lot closer to my house then Topanga location. They have lots of flat screen TV's for catching the game and cool picture decors of sports and movie poster all over their wall. The location inside the Northridge Mall is better and convenient alternative to eating at food court.  I usually come here when I go shopping at the mall and don't want to drive around town to look for a place to eat.   When I come here with a family and friends during lunch or dinner time, wait time averages about 10-20 minutes. Service is usually good depending how busy they are. I've had a few bad moments where the food took a long time or they made a mistake with my order, but followed by excellent service the next visit.  The burgers here are insanely delicious and they got a great selection to choose from on their menu. My favorite burgers are the whiskey BBQ and Royal Red Robin. The Whiskey BBQ Burger is infused with their signature bourbon BBQ sauce topped with cheddar cheese, crispy onion straws, lettuce, fresh tomatoes & mayo. The flavors just explode in your mouth and so delicious. While the Royal Red Robin is topped with fried egg, hardwood-smoked bacon, American cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo. The smokiness of the bacon and fried egg make this burger decadent and so good. Add bottomless fries and freckled lemonade which include free refills, I'm in food coma.  Overall - Red Robin is a fun place to kick back and enjoy good food. They also have great selections of salads and entrees for those who aren't in a burger mood. Note: They also have Glutten free bun's for those who are looking to reduce their carb intake.

This is truly one of my favorite restaurants to eat at.  They have a great selection of food and drinks.  They have flat screen tv's all over so you can watch what ever game is on from anywhere you are seated at.  The staff that work here are really great.  They're always very friendly and always check back on you to see if everything is ok.  I never once felt forgotten about; like how some restaurants can be depending on how busy they get.  Every time I come to this location there is never a wait.  I've always been seated right away.  This restaurant is for all people.  It's a very comfortable environment and the location is great with it being inside the Northridge Mall.  It's very easy to find on the outside if you are entering from the east side of the mall.

I went with 12 students and 3 staff members. We were teaching our students with special needs social skills, table manners, and restaurant etiquette. Michelle and Tracy were wonderful waitresses!! They were patient, and understanding. They gave each one of our student their own bill (they were learning about tipping)! Great experience. Thank you very much ladies!! The food was also delicious!!
Food is good the service is kinda blahh

For a burger joint, this place is very good.  Great service and location, inside the Northridge Fashion Center.  I almost went to Claim Jumper, but glad we settled on here.  It is rather large inside the restaurant, with a nice bar area and TV's everywhere. I chose the Whiskey BBQ burger, replacing the meat with a veggie patty.  Excellent.  BBQ sauce was good and the fries were thick and tasty. My friends ordered BBQ chicken salads that were too big to finish.  They looked like they enjoyed them.  Great lunch.  Thanks, Ashlee, for the great service.
Good burgeres, Nice atmosphere. Needs more healthy choices.

Bad experience: - Water tasted like it has tons of chemicals in it, even with lemon - Plates had finger prints all over - Chicken wings were soggy - Waitress placed bill on our table without refilling or asking whether we wanted more bottomless fries, although the fries were gone, and glasses were empty.

This place is really good if you want an upgrade from Innout or Mcdonalds. It's in the Northridge mall but it never gets too crowded. The longest I've had to wait was about 10 minutes.  I really like the Royal Red Robin and I always get garlic fries. It's bottomless fries so I don't order a side of regular fries since it already comes with the burger. I believe garlic fries are free. That's what a friend of mine told me and last time I went we ordered them and I checked the bill and there weren't any charges for garlic fries! Is it just me who didn't know this? I was simply amazed at this new facts. I'm not sure what the deal is but either way we weren't charged for garlic fries. Their onion rings are very good as well and a small is usually a good portion for two people.  Service is friendly and I never had any complaints about the servers there. Came by and checked up on us every now and then and all I ever had to ask for was the check. Parking is the mall parking lot so it can get crowded sometimes. I usually park in the upper lot because it tends to be less crowded up there and I just take the escalator down to the first floor where Red Robin is. Overall, good food, good service, and parking is not horrendous. I came here often and will continue to go here if I'm ever craving a burger.

It may be a franchise, but it's great!  Red Royalty. Let's start from the outside and move in.  Just looks like a store in the mall.  However the inside is much larger then other Red Robins.  Always enough booths unless you come on a busy day like Saturday.   Food is always great, usually get Boca Burgers instead of meat.  My favorite by far is the Bleu Ribbon Burger.  I usually skip the soda and get water. The employees here are great.  They all are obviously trained very well or really nice people.
Five stars for the food, atmosphere and price. Zero stars for the chemical water and our waitress Hillary because she was slow and we had no utensils. Asked other waiters for things we needed.

I have mixed feelings with Red Robin.  I think they have some decent party hour food and burgers that aren't too bad.  I've had a fair number of the burgers, including the chicken sandwiches and appetizers and you're not getting a top shelf burger but its sort of family meets beer. The main reason I gave the 2 stars instead of a 3 or 4 is that it seems to never fail I get terrible service.  The waiters and waitresses are nice enough but it seems they are spread too thin or there is a lack or organization between the management and their staff.  Training may also been needed on both sides to tighten the ship up. Typically it starts out well, I've always been seated quickly which is great, the menus are fast, the staff usually get the orders together and into the kitchen and the food generally comes out consistent and fairly quickly.  Where things tend to go south are refills on drinks or getting your waiter outside the times they specifically come by to see if you need anything else.  On a couple occasions I've had a obviously dirty cup (with some lettuce inside) and I understand they probably throw it through a machine washer but when it comes out the person stacking them for use missed it, whatever process it goes through to make it to the waiters stack missed it, the waiter missed it and then...it makes it to my table and if you don't catch it right away good luck trying to get your waiter for a replacement.  So this adds to my training comment or, it might be representative of a worse issue where the staff don't care to check the details, I'm hoping its the first one. I want this place to be better, until then, 2 stars it is.
Endless fries:) Tasty burgers and salads. Good service. Been here a handful of times and its pretty consistent.
Whenever my girl & I want to go chill someplace, we always default to Red Robin. Good food, good service, good prices, and great atmosphere. Can't ask for more than that.

Our latest experience at Red Robin was not great at all. Their food is decent, nothing spectacular, but we had a bone to pick with a couple of things. Firstly, their "endless" fries. They decreased the amount of fries they would have given you on a normal order and then made the rest endless - as if you would ask for another basket of fries. Why not just give me the regular amount of fries you would have given if I were in a normal restaurant. Our second beef was with the bad service. We were seated in the bar area at the high dining tables. Our server was very nice, very friendly and took our order very promptly. The trouble was that she was also the bartender, so she had to make all of the drinks for the entire restaurant and try to be a good server. Poor planning on Red Robins part. Go ahead and let the bartender be the bartender and assign a server to that area. It really put a damper on our whole dining experience.

Great customer service  - always friendly and responsive. The blue ribbon burger is always  good. The apple harvest chicken salad is good. It's really consistent and  a big step  from the rest of the food in the mall.
I really would give them less stars because of the food but thank you for reminding me avout my sunglasses i really appreciate that

As usual I am late with my review...  ate here last week with my sister and had to write a review to compliment the fantastic serving skills of Adam.  Adam made the dining-in  ordeal very fun and easy.  Great people skills, good sales skills, very accomodating and attentive.   The burgers are always great here, at least I enjoy them.  The ONLY problem I ever seem to have is that I cannot have my burger med-rare...  RR just doesn't do that, whatever, I've come to terms with this and moved on. Drinks are always fun...  cherry lime flip and screaming zombie are favorites.  Usually order to go but will be back eventually for another dine-in experience.  Hopefully we are lucky enough to get a server like Adam next time ...

Red Robin, Yummmmmmm! You know you sang that.  Service:  The 1st time I went it was okay, but I was sat at the bar and the bartender/waitress seemed busy with the males. Meh. 2nd time I had a AMAZING server. She was super friendly, knowledgable, joked with the table, and brought my dipping sauces and more bottomless fries. What a winner. I hope I get her next time I go. Food: Burgers have great flavor and fun combinations. My only problem is that whatever temp you ask them to cook it... it comes out well done. Thats okay, I don't want to get sick anyways.  I think I need to ask for crispy fries next time. I wonder if they do that. I loved their onion rings! They have the regular tower, a short tower, or 5 rings with your burger for a dollar or two... and you STILL get endless fries.  Bathroom: Clean. That makes me happier about eating at a restaurant.

A family favorite before or after a day of shipping at Northridge Fashion Center... There has been a few times where the wait is long; and waiting or trying to get the attention of a waiter or waitress was even longer but my most recent experience was quite pleasant. There were 8 of us and they accommodated us within 20 minutes. Our drink order was placed and they arrived very quickly. While we did not have utensils, they were brought after the food. They got our order right; and when we paid using our Red Robin Royalty Card they removed one of our burgers! Awesome! The food was great, the service was great and all was well. It won't be the last time we visit Red Robin - were fans!

It feels weird giving Red Robin 4-stars; but I am a fan so I shall give them what they deserve according to the yelp standard. This Red Robin is located within the mall, which most are. The staff was surprisingly awesome. Our server, a white male (sorry, I didn't catch his name), was beyond fabulous. Even though we stopped by Friday night when the place was completely swamped our server was on top of EVERYTHING.  We got the Ribbon Burger which came with a sunny side egg, bacon (fake bacon), and endless fries for about $11. The burger came out medium which was awesome since that's how we wanted it, the egg was runny, just how I like it, and they didn't skimp on the bacon.  Overall   The foods a-ok and definitely gets the job done but the service is what bumped them up to 4-stars.  Tip  HH 8-close  Try their strawberry lemonade; free refills
Came here for the first game of the NFL. The bar is pretty good as well as the bartenders. I would've liked to see more than one tv at the bar though. Their wings and chips weren't bad either.
Great food. If you go in a little later in the evening the service kinda sucks.

When it comes to gourmet burger chains, Red Robin ranks near the top of my list. They just don't disappoint when it comes to a good burger.  The other night a friend and I stumbled into the Northridge Red Robin about half an hour before closing, and we were given an awesome experience. The waitress Tabitha was a real sweetheart; very kind, attentive, and sociable.  We ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger with a turkey burger substitute. Our food was brought out pretty quick, and we were showered in bottomless steak fries. It was a good night fulfilling a munchies fix. I'll definitely be coming back to this location.

This was my first trip to Red Robin and I reckon, it will probably be my last. Firstly, I'm not a huge fan of shopping malls. Albeit, the restaurant is actually located in the Northridge Fashion Center, which I didn't know until my friend told me, as we were approaching the mall. She failed to leave out this important detail, when asking me if I wanted to get a bite to eat. She kinda suckered me into to going, telling me how great a place Red Robin is. She obviously, therefore, has eaten at some real shitholes, if she considers this a great place.  I believe her ulterior motive, was just to go clothes shopping. So she slighty engaged in deception, to get me to take her. I was hungry, so I was looking for some food. Since I hadn't been to Red Robin before, I was definitely willing to try it. Had I known it was at a mall, I reckon I would've gotten the flu.  The first thing I noticed was how crappy and congested it was. That was before we actually ate anything, just as we stepped inside. It gets worse. The only way the tables could be closer together would be to stack them. I hate sitting on stranger's laps when I'm eating. If you have no personality, this is definitely the hangout for you. Make sure you take a really good look at the staff on the way in, because that's the last you'll see of them. We just went and sat at the first table we saw that was available. Since the hostess didn't seem that eager to seat us. Just out of curiosity, are the waiters trained to bang into you, as you walk to the restroom? For a moment, I thought I was looking at a picture on the wall, when suddenly it moved, it was our waitress. On this day, the staff was charmingly incompetent. This place probably has a great reputation for those people who don't get out much. I asked the waitress if I could please get a strawberry lemonade, "Of course, not a problem?" Well it obviously was a problem, because she brought me a Diet Coke. I know strawberry lemonade and Diet Coke sound exactly the same, but she did write it down, so I thought.  After a long and ardous job of deciding what to eat, I just settled on a chicken breast sandwich and a caesar salad on the side. I figured this should be a safe bet, assuming they cook the chicken. Poor assumption! Unfortunately, they seemed not to have learned yet, that heat is an integral part of the cooking process. This would actually be a really good place to take co-workers you don't like. The food may be awful, but at least the service was slow, they're certainly consistent at something.  My chicken breast sandwich comes with an entire vegetable garden, which would've been fine, if I was either a rabbit or the vegetables were fresh. At least my buns were soggy from all the water on my plate, from the six pounds of veggies they tossed on top of them. They've obviously mastered the art of making a chicken breast sandwich inedible. It's obvious, the food tastes better on the menu. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because the strawberry lemonade, and the beautiful artwork on the walls, everything else sucked. BTW: unless you've been to this mall, or know someone who has (thanks Amber), than you'll hopefully never find this place, tucked away in the corner. Anytime a mall tries to hide a restaurant from the customers, that should be a warning! The fellow Yelpers that rated this place 4 & 5 stars, definitely had to be intoxicated or smoking some good shit. Here's a suggestion: just get your customers plastered or high before allowing them to eat. Then they'll give you 10 stars, hopefully before they pass out.

people are not welcoming and doesnt smile.  orders and checks is taking forever knowing that there's not a lot of people.    i order the fish and chips, the battered are so greesy looks like they didny drain the oil before they served it and the fries was cold.   if you're a big fan of  high cholesterol and left over food this joint is highly recommended :(

First and foremost, the only reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars is because of our waiter. Second of all, I have no idea what was going on with the kitchen staff.  I went in with my close friend who had never been to a Red Robin before. Our waiter, Bryan, was amazing, funny, nice and on point with everything. I told him that it was my friend's first time eating there, and that we needed to make it a good and memorable experience. And boy, was it. My friend ordered the smoke and pepper signature burger, medium well, pepper jack cheese and 2 patties. Mind you, it's an extra $4 for the double patty. I ordered the big tavern, well done, no tomatoes. When the food was brought to us, my friend's burger only had 1 patty, cooked well done with the wrong cheese.  When Bryan came back to check up on us, we told him that my friend was missing a patty and that we'd wait for them to correct the order. It'd take about 15 minutes for the patty to cook. While we waited, I bit into my burger and almost threw up. The meat was cooked medium rare. I absolutely hate, hate, hate uncooked meat (with the exception of sushi).  Bryan brought my friend the correct burger and was caught off guard when I told him that mine was wrong too. I really don't like causing problems and I've never had to send food back because it was wrong for whatever reason, but this was ridiculous. I told him that I wasn't going to pay for our food especially since the whole order was done wrong. He said he understood, and went to consult with the general manager. The manager came back, apologized, brought us the correct orders and removed the food from our bill.  Apparently the kitchen staff had been messing up orders all day long. Not good for a Saturday. All I can say is, we won't be coming back and my friend definitely had a memorable experience.

They have bottomless firs and you can always order your fries first before for your burger. They have there season salt at the table so you can add more to your liking, but they always come out perfect! They just recently updated their menus for a nice clean easy look. The service is always wonderful and the food is always delicious. The only thing is they are always linked to a mall and most of the time it's always crowded so you have to look for a parking spot. They have interesting decor with lots of memorabilia up. They have a great selection of drinks and I'm a big iced tea person, which they have several flavors of. They have shakes with real ice cream and they even give you that old school extra cup that you add more to your cup with. A great place to eat and chill!

Good burgers, bottomless fries, super quick service. The burgers are good for the price, and they give you unlimited fries (ask for your fries while you wait). The service is very fast and friendly. Nice place while your at the mall for a sit down lunch or dinner.

stoppped in to grab a beer and kill some time on a Saturday afternoon. The bartender was nice but unless you sit right in the middle of the bar you don't get a good view of the tiny tvs. Maybe an upgrade to the sets is due. The restaurant looked a tad messy as there were many empty tables with dirty dishes on them for the half hour or so while I was there.

It's a hamburger joint IN A MALL. Bring the kids. It's nice and loud, and there are all sorts of sporting events playing on the T.V.'s. Bottomless fries! Chicken sandwiches aren't bad, ask for them well done, or else they come out still clucking. Wait staff acts as if they don't like being there. Note to management; work the floor and pay attention.

I'm torn.  My meal was disappointing, but the service was on-point.  Thus, 3 stars. Came here with two of my law school friends when I went back to visit.  Yeah, we's classy, kids.  They didn't have the right gin for a drink.  Charging $.75 for special sauces on French Fries is tres not classy.  Complaining about that is probably tres not classier! (No one complained except me right now.)  You can't go wrong with the award-winning Royal Red Robin, right?  Complete with an egg over-easy?  It's won an award four years running - other burgers, hide in fear for the reigning heavyweight champion of the world is the ROYAL RED ROBIN.  Mine was undercooked (patty fringe was pink) and the egg did not run at all.  I suppose I should give them credit for being able to contrast temperatures so well.   ... Clever marketing scheme.  Endless fries, but $.75 cent dips is brilliant.  Reminds me of the razor/razor blade model of business. ... Service was great.  Apologized for drink and meal.  Recognized that since one of us ordered Endless fries that the other buddy didn't have to.  Just a friendly person.  Looked around, and servers were talking with their guests as well.  Good vibe. dmo out.
Waitress was terrible. Food was not what was describe on the menu.  LOVE the speckled lemonade

It's a good resto for gourmet burgers, shakes and endless fries. I would split a burger and order a salad. I am not super keen on this location being in the mall but it has been a godsend while shopping.

I can't with this place! Maybe it's just me but 2 out of the 3 times I've been here the customer service was not good. One time I went I had the rudest server and another time I got charged for an amount that was different than what I signed for. Aside from customer service the food is really good I just can't deal with this particular location anymore.

So I ordered a turkey burger and added guacamole to it .... well I thought I did. Adam told me they charged $1.50 for it, I said alright at that price it must be a spoon full. Burger came, saw it had a teaspoon of guac, asked Adam what the deal was, maybe a mistake, he said they used it as a spread. Well, for $1.50 thats some BS. We hardly ever complain and give them the benefit and asume it was an honest mistake, not today. Not coming back. Gourmet prices, not quality. So ADAM came back after I finished the burger and said " oh that burger is gone !" Yeah bro, I came to eat not lolly gag, doesn't mean I didn't eat it angrily because of the $1.50 guac guac guac, well lack thereof. Well Adam, may your god bless you with a child. ..... or 2.

I must admit I have always been a fan of Red Robin. The Northridge location always seems to be on their game as far as customer service and quality of their food. I can't resist their crispy chicken sandwhich tossed in buffalo sauce with extra crispy fries and side of ranch OINK! The staff is always so bubbly and always seems happy to be there. Red Robin will always have my business!

Came to this Red Robin location for my cousins B-Day. The wait was an hour which I didn't mind I guess.. The servers were very polite. We had a group of 12 so I expected awesome service.. The service was okay, nothing to great.. Food was good, restaurant was clean, bathrooms were also. That's a plus.. Cute waitresses also. Ahaha

Came here yesterday for the complimentary bday burger.  Note: it's my first time at any Red Robin restaurant.  I ordered: [1] tall black & blue from the bar and a double cheeseburger with bacon.  It arrived in about 20 minutes, and came alongside a metal cup of steak fries.  The fries were cold, but the burger was cooked to order.  The burger tasted awesome, and the service from our waitress was great.  I'd definitely recommend this spot, and would gladly return for a taste of another burger on their menu.  Hopefully I get fresh fries next time.  Oh yeah, service from the waitress was great--I give her a solid 5/5.
Decent food and convenient. Nice family atmosphere and TV's to watch the game on. Nothing too special, but it gets the job done.  Although it sounds dirty the bottomless fries are a tasty treat.

Let me start off by saying the first time I have ever eaten here the manager and waitress was so rude. I did not eat there for a good few years. Then a couple years ago I ate there again and the waiter I had was so kind and the manager even checked up with us. It was definitely a turn around. Ever since then I come often for a good burger. Every burger I've tried is really good and their mint shake is amazing. They add brownie bites to it! Never had a problem since the first time. I hope I never do again.

Good burgers and great fries. The chicken strips (clucks) are also really good. They have a good selection if salads and burgers. Its also a place to eat that can be kind of healthy. They'll make your salad into a wrap.

it has been a while since i have visited Red Robin, and today has been the best yet! probably because i was with my girlfriend, but still good was fantastic  today we had a waiter named Javier; guy was super chill, down to earth, and friendly. didn't push, didn't over check, quick refills, friendly service, and brought our friend a bowl of fries since she did not order anything and he felt bad today i ordered the new smoke & pepper burger, medium well patty, and my girlfriend ordered the banzai burger, well done.  the smoke and pepper burger was delicious! simple, yet the flavors worked great! I'm not sure if the meat is different or a higher grade, but it tasted much better than the past burgers i have had (not that Red Robin ever had bad burgers, it was just better this time) the smokey ketchup was very tasty, savory and strong, Javier even brought an extra side of it! So good i poured some more on! The ciabatta was fresh and soaked up the flavor, cheddar was a nice thick slice for optimal flavor, and plenty of bacon for every bite! i also asked for a side of chipotle ailoi for the fries, though it was an extra cost for a premium sauce, no biggie, but Javier also brought an extra one for my girlfriend! awesome!  the fries were alright this time, not many crispy ones but all had plenty of their seasoning on the fries for extra delicious flavor!  for drinks i got the peach iced tea, sweet refreshing delicious, and girlfriend got the strawberry lemonade, which was fantastic!  literally full of chunks of sweet strawberries and sliced lemons, it was the best strawberry lemonade I've had! lol will definitely be back!

Went in today with two friends and our server was Brandon. He was probably the best and the nicest server I've ever had. He was super prompt and super helpful even thug the restaurant was busy. Every other server I've had has been super weird, but I like their bottomless fries and their burgers so I keep coming back.  Our food came out promptly and even if it didn't I wouldn't even be upset because I knew how busy it was and Brandon made our experience that pleasant.  I love that they don't charge for condiments and are very accommodating with orders.  Keep up the good service.

So for the past few months I have had a major hard-on for Red Robin. Let me tell you why: The food is soooooo gooooooooooooood. I would've given it 5 stars but the servers are super awkward and sometimes don't listen with the exception of Brandon who was the best waiter I've had here so far!! Give that man a raise! The other servers I have were totally frazzled and scatter brained. He seems like the only one that knows how to keep his shit together.   Let me recommend the whiskey river burger and getting your fries out first! Best decision I ever made was to get my fries out first. Also, the peach tea is perfection. My sister, my friend, and I are all obsessed with it. It's perfect. I am also recommending the cookie magic shake. Holy hell!! My sister got the smaller version of this and when we tried it, we quickly called over our server to upgrade to the monster version cuz we had to have more ASAP! It's that good.  Last but not least I just want to tell Red Robin that I'm not paying $9 for an f'ing tower of onion rings. Gimme a break! You guys need to take that down a notch. I could make 100 onion rings for less than that. How dare you! But I love you, Red Robin!

My boyfriend and I were shopping around at the mall and decided we wanted red robin. We were sat right away and the hostess was sweet, BUT when we were sat NOONE greeted us, took our drink orders, or even asked if we had been helped for at least 10 minutes. So many servers were working and even walked by us with no acknowledgment and it was obvious we haven't been helped because we had no waters or utensils at our table and I even was looking around hoping a server would notice. We just got up and left. Very disappointing service at this location.

I adore the food at Red Robin. Being gluten free, it's wonderful to find a place that has gluten free buns. Their shakes are great, and so are their fries. My biggest complaint about this particular location is the management. They haven't a clue about customer service (If they prepare something wrong, they basically blame your taste buds.) HOWEVER, the wait staff is great, and the food itself keeps me coming back. :)
I had a great time. Took my daughter and wife out for a family dinner and they cater to our every need. Such friendly staff. Would really recommend going back.

We arrived at location and was greeted well.  We were sat in minutes and the waiter arrived within minutes.  He was awesome!  He came by every few minutes and offer refills.  He was polite and friendly.  I suggest requesting to sit on his table in the future.  Bravo to him and red robin in hiring staff that care His name is Zachary M

I'm a fatty, I love my bottomless fries. The waitress was very attentive and made sure both our fries and drinks were filled at all times! I had just a regular tavern burger and it was heaven in between a bun. The patty was juicy and full of flavor, I didn't want it to end. Hahaha. Service is never lacking here.

Today they offered half off on all their hamburgers to the members of red Royalty program what a deal. The burger tasted great and the fries where hot and seasoned just right. The only issue I had was when they brought over my Ice tea they didn't offer me any sugar, I had to get up and get it from the bartender. The server never asked me would you like any desert or anything else. Just put the bill on the table. Hmmmm. Maybe some suggestive selling before putting the bill on the table,or asking the guest would you like anything else.

Not bad.  I had the avo-cabo salad and that was humongous for only $10.  I split it with my daughter and we were both satisfied for less than a drive-through meal!  Also the freckled lemonade (which is basically lemonade with strawberries) was very refreshing.

Terrible service. The waitress "lost" my simple order of one burger. Didn't get the burger till 45 mins after I ordered it. After the burger was delivered by the manager, the waitress didn't come back to check on me. Waited another 15 mins for a fry refill. Seriously not worth it.
Probably the best place to eat......... while at the mall anyway.  Service is just as decent.
Great food great service great cold beer I love this place ! And in the mall after uo grub you can shop hahha great job red robin I'll def come back again and again

Love this place and their unlimited fires. Was surprise to see they also offer refill on specialty drinks and refills on MAC N CHESSE!!! Short story, my daughter was really happy and my wife is now a fan too

The food is fresh and fine for burgers but Devin the bar tender is AWESOME!! His service was more than five stars. We would come back again for lunch just to chat him up and brighten up our work day!!

If it wasn't for the kids wanting to eat at this location, we wouldn't come here. This is the second time this happened. First visit, they forgot all about our food. It was pretty late and there wasn't a lot of customers in the restaurant and they still forgot about us. Today's visit was probably worst. The waitress who took our drink order was different from the one who took our food order. Wasn't really sure who was our actual waitress. The food came out and they totally messed up one of our orders so we had to wait a while for that one. Then they forgot to give us the right fries, we ordered sweet potato fries and they also forgot the dips we requested. We even asked her a few times!!! They didn't even give us any napkins!! We had to ask for them too!!!! This is THE WORST RED ROBIN location ever!!!! Sucks because the kids really like Red Robin. We have no problems at the other Red Robin locations that we go to (Topanga and Glendale) I'm usually pretty nice when it comes to waitresses because I used to be one; but seriously?!! it's not even that busy!!! She had 3 tables tops!!! I just don't get it!! :X
The burgers are awesome!  Chicken... Uuummmm not really good at all. Customer service gets a 5 star, but because of the food we give it a 4 Javier helped us and he had very good customer service!

No idea why I cant give them 0 stars! Lunch order, you'll be waiting 30 minutes just to put an order in on the phone. Oh, walk in on your lunch break? You'll be sitting at the bar for 20 before you even get your order taken. Who's to blame? Hostess- nope, because the bartender takes your order. Bartender- nope because they can only do so much when they have a full bar. Management- BINGO! The staff will only work as hard as their manager needs them to work. And I bet they're just sitting in the cool office munching on fries.

I have to say my 1 bad experience didn't keep me away from red robin. Id like to think management has changed leading to my better experiences. I probably visit this location 2-3X a month sometimes. If there is a wait I'll sit at the bar. Love all the bar tenders. Funny, sweet, overall great customer service. The screaming zombie drink is tasty and the BBQ chicken wrap is my go to favorite.

Food is always delicious. Bottomless strawberry lemonade.   Service is a hit or miss every time.  You either get great service or you get "no service" technically.  The hosts (male and females) are always very nice and enthusiastic, though!

We've been here several times and the food and service have been good. Today we seated ourselves in the bar area and waited...nobody came and we left. Fortunately Wood Ranch is close by. Disclaimer: this isn't typical. Normally they'd be a 3.5.

Really good burgers! But last time i ate there i ordered a chicken burger and the meat was undercooked. I told the waiter about it and all they did was apologize and they did my burger again. While i was waiting for my burger i felt like an idiot watching my wife eat.

Oh my goodness, I have been waiting to write this review! LMFAO. Okay, the food here is great! Only thing is...they seat people by your race, lmfao. Seriously! So, the minorities...sit on one side of the restaurant in the booths, and the white people get served on the outside of the booths by the windows, hahahaha.  I thought it was the funniest thing while I was out having lunch, until my friend pointed it out. Every new minority would get seated in our section, and every white family that walked in would get seated out in the open.  Why do they do this? I don't know. But, it's definitely not nice, and very noticeable! Lmfao. But, yes...the food was good. I'll give them that. Yay. :)

Too many delicious places at the mall for a place to turn out with bad food.  My hubby and I walked immediately to bar area to order, there was 1 couple drinking and waiting for their food, 1 older guy who's already finished his free b day burger and keeps ordering fries. As this older guy is asking her if he can get another order of fries, she puta him on hold and ask as were sitting what would we like to order or do we need a menu, I reply no I know what I want. My hubby went to the restroom, I ordered my food, I paid and I was told 15 mins so I went to restroom. All 3 stalls were occupied so I waited. After a good 7-10 mins I return to the bar where my hubby was waiting.  After returning I noticed another guy there looking thru the menu and drinking a beer from the tap. The bar chic ask if he's ready to order, he replied with a hesitant no and she suggested a simple plain burger. He eventually ordered. A few minutes later he gets his food. We sat a bit longer I ordered a cookie magic milkshake which was good (except she spilled some and filled that missing portion with whip cream). After the guy nearly finished half his burger, my hubby asked if our wait is longer due to it carry out. She said no its all the same but she's checking for our food. Eventually it comes and and I check for freshness. I ordered their "Famous cheeseburger" no oinons, Swiss cheese.  1st offense, I waited nearly between 30-45 mins to get my order, 2 O. My fries were so cool to the point they choked you when trying to eat them. I said I'm going to need some fresh fries. If my wait was this long one would assume they'll be hot. Bar chic claimed she just watched them put them in the box. 3 Offense; My patty was the only thing hot, the little lettuce that was on the burger was wilted, along with the tomato, so we're the pickles and the cheese nearly choked me due to them adding extra on the burger that I didn't ask for. This was thee worst burger I've ever all for nearly $10.  The last true offense was that I saw 3 burgers come out prior to mines and their lettuce, tomato, pickles all appeared to be fresh and crisp. What was the problem with mine. I wasn't rude, I smiled and politely answered and ordered, paid walked away and returned. It's times like these that I get upset with myself for not demanding what I paid for. Good thing my hubby has a stomach of steel and ate my food instead.

I came here for dinner and it was delicious! I got the turkey burger with the chipotle aioli. I know you're wondering, why in the hell would you get a turkey burger for a restaurant that specializes in delicious beef burgers? Why order a turkey burger ever? It was a lazy attempt at being healthy. I should mention I ordered the bottomless sweet potato fries which were DELICIOUS. Perfectly cooked and crispy, greasy in that good way, with a light sprinkling of sea salt that really just worked. My dad even ate them and he claims he hates sweet potato fries. He ate too many.  But anyway, I was expecting this dried out, under seasoned, bland burger but I got a delicious, perfectly cooked burger that had the perfect blend of spice. The chipotle aioli added a really nice kick and it was so good! I regret not dipping my fries in it. What am I doing with my life? Making poor choices apparently. But this turkey burger was not a poor choice.  As Forrest MacNeil would say "Eating a turkey burger at Red Robin: 4 stars"

Located in the Northridge mall. The wait was long for our grumbling tummys this Friday night, so we walked right into the bar area and our order was immediately taken. I got their bruschetta chicken sandwich and was not disappointed. It's delicious! The waitress was nice and attentive. I loved Red Robin so when I'm in the area, I'll probably be back again.

The food and atmosphere is always better at this Red Robin than the one in the Topanga Mall. My Tavern Burger was cooked right, the fries weren't burned, our lovely server was at the top of her game and was very attentive; refilled glasses often and checked if we needed more fries, dressing, etc. No complaints, my girls and I had a lovely evening. Oh and those bottomless fries always help make your evening a better one.

What a horrible experience Went in and say at bar. Ordered a vodka gimlet and water from Stephanie. Took 5 minutes to get water and then she forgot my drink all together.  Finally got it. Ordered food and it came like warm. No bread with salad.  Asked waitress and she never brought it.  Took another couple minutes to get silverware and then asked bread from bartender, Stephanie.  Finished meal before it even came.  Got bill.  Guess she was oblivious to the crappy service.  Tipped and left. Not going back

Came here with a friend while visiting the mall. Our server's name was Devin and he was AMAZING. Extremely polite, friendly and helpful. He also had us laughing. He helped me decide on a burger and it was such a great decison! My burger was yummy! He was honestly the best representation of what customer service should be. Not only am I giving 5 stars for our server, we were seated quickly despite them being busy and we didnt wait long for our food. Cant wait to go back ^.^

Food was great as usual.  Customer service sucked! No crackers for our soup, No napkins, No refills, We had to ask for everything!  :( Waited 15 mins for our check And another 20 mins for our change.  Frustrating...

Red robin is my go to place usually because I have Celiac Disease and they have many gluten free options and are usually excellent with preparing my food. Unfortunately I went there for lunch today and I got extremely sick after. I eat there fairly often and have never had a problem before until today.     I must say I am not surprised that I got sick today because my waiter Chris was AWFUL. Horrible customer service and he barely even came to our table to see how we were doing. My diet coke was flat and my burger was cold. The fries tasted really old and they were hard. I found myself having too seek out our waiter Chris when I needed something and often noticed him socializing with co-workers.      It's safe to say I DID NOT ENJOY my experience at red robin today. It's really unfortunate because since I am gluten free, I am limited to where I can eat out. I am nervous to go back, but out of the many times I have been there, I have never had a problem. Hopefully next time they will take me seriously when I say I have an extreme intolerance. I gave them two stars because usually the customer service is on point and my food is incredible.

Pros: - Great price for great food.  -Plenty of parking  -Located in the mall  -Family-friendly  -Sociable/Speedy Customer Service  Cons:  -Long wait  -They do not have pagers to que guests when table is ready.  -Really crowded -Bottomless fries portion is so small!! Overall great chain if you are looking for a burger. I ordered the BBQ Chicken "Burger". The chicken was succulent and moist; the onion rings were crispy so overall I loved the "burger". It's a huge portion so was full for the rest of the night. Great if you are looking to spend less than $15 per meal. Great customer service!

Love this place! Customer service is great. I recommend the bbq chicken wrap. Delicious. If you are in the mall this season stop by and eat at this restaurant better then all the fast food in the food court.

Ok, so me and my boyfriend went on a Monday night. and they made us wait 15 minutes for a table. There was clearly seeeveral tables available. So I wondered why the wait. They sat us by the bar area and the waitress came up to us after 10 minutes of waiting.We got our ordered fairly fast. However, we knew that at Red Robin there is bottomless fries. and that is what my boyfriend came for. He waited 20mins for his 2nd round of bottom fries. Which really irritated him. Then when we asked for our check, we waited another 10mins for that. We should have just given her my ATM right away because she did come back to get it. She was literally running around with her head cut off. She was bartending and serving people at the same time. She seemed very frustrated, and you could tell she needed help. They were very short staffed here and they really need to work on their customer skills.

Terrible service.  Took forever to get us water or even take our order to begin with!! I ordered the bbq wrap and the portion was a little small for my taste.  I was expecting a lot more than the tiny wrap I was served, especially for the price.   It wasn't expensive or anything but the portion was just tiny.  The wrap was bland!  I literally drowned my wrap in bbq sauce to cover up the stale tortilla strips and fake cheese in my food!!  There was slightly any flavor, if any at all!!  Just bad quality food in general.   One of my friends had to order fries and the fruit salad at least 5 minutes ahead of time because the wait was ridiculous.  Mind you this place wasn't even packed!  By the way, the fruit salad was a disaster. Some of the fruit was still frozen.  It was such a surprise when I took a bite.   This place is just mediocre from the food to the service.  Never coming here again!!

This post is only recieveing one star because of my burger but in the other hand the service was horrible. The waitress's never paid attention to us. They gave me my burger and never my onion rings. She wouldn't come check up on us. She never gave us our appetizer and when they finally did they were burnt
I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good burger! I come here all the time and I've never been disappointed. :)
One of my family favorite restaurants. Food always hot and prepared right. Highly recommended. The bar also great and tv to watch your favorite sports.

I love the food but the service was not so great, it made my experience from giving a 5 star rating to a 2 star .  I was very disappointed with the sarcastic rude attitude that was provided by server, he was very rude. But the food quality is great.

I love this location. The staff is friendly and the food bomb! The fries always keep me Coming back but everything in general is well prepared. Make sure to sign up for the birthday burger to get your free burger that day. This is a great place to come to. The portions are also very big so sharing is possible, especially with the bottomless fries (this works if you're broke too, just share with someone). I will definitely be back to eat those fries soon. :D

This place has tasty hamburgers. I wish they would use fresh avocado!! Because I order a hamburger with avocado on it & they put a nasty guacamole salsa instead! That's why I only gave this place 3 stars; but the fries were delightful.  Prices: Okay.  Service: Average. The restaurant was clean.
Service was great! Burgers were tasty. The only thing bugging me was the restrooms they were super dirty! No toilet paper! No paper towels to dry your hands. I walked out the restroom with wet hands.
First time coming here had a guacamole bacon burger with bottomless steak fries it was very delicious.  Our waitress was very awesome. Would definitely come again.

Poor service from.beginning to end. Told 25 min wait. We waited almost an hr then when askong were told oh setting table now. 10 min later oh cleaning your table. Finally at table waited 20 for server to take drink order. When trying tonorder food was hesitant but we made him take order then. Then 25 min for soggy oil dripping tasyeless fish and chips. Waited 35 min for sugar for tea. No silver ware or napkins. Had to ask when salads came to table. Yea friday night but come on. Very very unsatisfied customer. And i love red robin. Never coming back here again.

It's not my first time here and I always have a decent experience but this time the burger buns were soggy :(  The waitress was super nice!  The restaurant was clean... So I'll prob be back and hope next time is better.
I've come here maybe like 4 or 5 times and every time it's been consistently great. The burgers are delicious and always perfectly cooked. Onion rings are bomb as well.
Burgers are bomb, my only concern is staff isn't very attentive.
At the Northridge Mall so the family decided to go burger tonight.  Burgers were cooked the way we all wanted it  Best of all, GREAT service from Alicia.

food is good...it's the waiters that suck not coming to this Red Robbins any more! Plates were basically tossed to the table they only came like 2 times to our table never offered to get us refills and when we asked it will take her 20 min to come back with our drinks I could have choked waiting for that lady not friendly at all looks like she hated her job not my problem...what ever happened to customer service with a smile!?!?!
Always bomb over here. Royal Red Robin. That egg though on the burger with the strawberry lemonade!

So, I live nearby to this location and have been going there since it opened. When it did first open everything was fine, not the Best Red Robin ever, but no major complaints...now things have changed drastically. The service is horrific almost to the point that we almost walked out to see if anyone would say anything. Over the past five visits or so, the service has been quite terrible. It is difficult to place an order,...takes forever to get food,...if you need something (napkin, refills, "bottomless fries" LOL), ...you want the Bill....want to PAY your Bill...it is very difficult to flag down a waitress. Each waitress works a specific section and will not help each other out like in other good restaurants...and it is easy to see why. They have cliques within the restaurant, even the managers/supervisors have little groups...it is like watching a reality show on TV :P They do not act like it is a job, they do not work as a team. I have not seen this before in a real workplace...not to this degree. It is really sad. Other customers were having the same problem and we all just looked at each other like what is this?!? ...oh why do we keep going back every other month? My wife loves the ensenada chicken...~sigh~....we could drive up to the Valencia Red Robin, long drive though. Maybe we will just take it to go next time...

I hear the catchy commercials all the time but never gave it a chance & I'm SUPER happy I did! The service was great, the food was fantastic & my friend and I left with  happy/full bellies lol. I'll be coming back!!

Red Robin rocks! They have a Zombie drink that will literally have you walking like a Zombie. The appetizers are really good and I love going after work for happy hour. The customer service is really good too.

It's been awhile since I've been to this Red Robin, and I'm so glad I decided to eat here for dinner!! I had my usual, the Bleu Robin with sweet potato fries (unlimited!!!! Omg) and both were delicious!!! The service was spectacular!! We requested a booth and it was perfect.  The host noticed that we were eyeing the TVs a bit later and came back (because the bbal finals were on) and she asked if we wanted to be closer. We said we were fine but appreciated that she even offered.  Our server, Conny, and the other guy (sorry, I don't know his name) were awesome! They were attentive and helpful the entire time.  The reason for the negative .5 star? The prices seem a bit high.  Other than that, I'd definitely dine here again.

(+) Burgers... gourmet ones! IMHO, the Whiskey River BBQ Burger is the best (+) I'm also a fan of the Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich (note: you can sub the chicken for a beef patty, it's even tastier (+) Unlimited fries! Note: you can substitute (for free) with either Coleslaw, Side Salad, or Steamed Broccoli (+) Usually good service, seated right away (lots of tables), and conveniently near a mall entrance and parking lot (-) Prices are a little high for a burger... but they cook them well (to order) and have good topping combinations. The tavern burgers are subpar but cheaper and served double. (-) They charge for their "custom" dipping sauces... realllly?

I must be picking the wrong burgers. Don't get me wrong they aren't horrible at all, I just don't find them amazing. I'm a fries girl and theirs falls short in that department, onion tower looks cool and tastes ok, nothing that a little ranch can't fix. Service is always great.
I've been to this location three times and I'm happy to report the burgers have been delicious each time.  Our server, Marina, was friendly and made good recommendations.  I'm definitely coming back.

Been here several times. It is what it is. Burgers are pretty good and they have a fairly interesting selection. Bottomless french fries that are always hot and well seasoned and pretty good milkshakes.. Service is always adequate but can be a bit slow & flustered... Place tends to be a little on the loud side ....lots of kids and families which is fine, but not always what I'm looking for. All in all always just kind of an average experience. We go for the bottomless fries. If you're looking for a great burger there are better options for the same price or less.. If you have kids certainly a place to consider.....

Sitting at the bar and although I love the blue moon cooler this has got to be one of the slowest service I have ever had at a bar. There are now five people at the bar and it took ten minutes to get my drink.  The really sad thing is when I got here it was just me and it took just as long.

I used to go to Red Robin once a month for the past several years. I went yesterday, just to find out the company has changed its policies for the worst service ever. I could no longer order a smaller portion salad, and ended up throwing half of it in the trash. Why should I waste food if I know I don't eat a lot? They also would not allow me to get focaccia bread. They said the focaccia bread is only for the pizza dough. Pizza is only offered for kids! That's very WRONG! Instead they give two sad little pieces of garlic toast. I Don't want something I can make cheaply and easily at home! They got rid of the Splenda a while back, and the cheap crap has no flavor. Why do I need to pay to bring my own??? Customer satisfaction is not a priority for Red Robin. All they care about is company policies!!! All restaraunts are mandated to follow the same rules. This is wrong! Not all customers are the same!

I love all the food there. The only thing I don't like is that the hamburger buns fall apart while you are eating. It turns your great burger into a mess. It's nice to be able to get different kinds of shakes/malts....chocolate banana malt etc. Great choices. I wish the tables for two were a bit bigger. And when the restaurant has a good amount of people there, it gets too loud. Probably from the ceiling tiles. I'm giving a 2 star rating bc of the loudness, & not being able to hear my friends talk to me.

Came by for a quick eat before going back home, woth my fiancee. Ordered the black(?) and bleu burger for about $16 included substituted garlic fries. The fries were over seasoned, to say the least. There were veritable mounds of seasoning on the fries. For allegedly unlimited fries, I was not brought any more after my fiancee pilfered a couple. The burger, on the other hand, was very tasteless. I ordered medium-rare. The bleu cheese was not noticeable on the burger and there were only two small mushrooms, the rest being "caramelized" onions that didnt spend much time being on the pan, to be sure. The patty itself was alright but was just a slab of meat, no seasoning at all. Not sure what cheese was put on the patty but it was nondescript. Overall a terrible burger and meal in general.  To be fair though, our waitress Shelby was exceptional and incredibly friendly and had no problem working with my fiancee's food allergy.

yesterday mon jul 6, 2015 at 7:30 i ate a whisky chicken burger i didnt really check if it was cooked correctly because i was focused on feeding my son after i left the restaurant and dropped off my son.  about 15 mins after dropping him off  i started to throw up uncontrollably i threw up more that 15 times at least 20 after i felt soo dizzy mind you i didnt have no alcoholic beverage and the last time i ate was around 12 so it couldnt have been something i ate before red robin and i was driving to pick my gf up i was planning on waiting in front of the resturant but i didnt even make it on time because i was throwing up so much on the way back and when i got there i threw up where the loading dock is right in front of the resturant if you go right now i am pretty sure you will see the  throw up the only thing that got me pissed off was that i was driving and all this shit was happening and my son ate some of the food red robin offered me 40 dollars to shut me up and said they would take it into further investigation lol my food is in a trash bag and away from the restaurant no need for investigation i even called corporate and i asked to speake to the manager in guest services and they wouldnt let me talk to them i asked if they had his number and they said i only have an email then i asked if they have ever met him and she said no heather matabueno from canada and her manager mckenzie blanco which sounds like some made up names but i swear man i was throwing up soo hard that my whole body felt weak i even had to put my arm around my gf because i felt drained stephen carley this is how you treat your customers by poisoning them if my gf was not there i would have crashed !

Wth happened red robin ! I love red robin but with the new menu changes i decided to go somewhere else . First of all your waiters/waitress need to be more knowledgeable on your product . If I would have know that my salad was just going to be literally 3 lettuce spears I would have ordered something else . $9.89 should not be a price to pay for something like that . On top of that my lettuce was not only hot but it looked old . When I received it after 25 min of waiting we go silverware once we got one we shared .  After the above duty of cutting up my salad I come to find I have no fork so I got tired of waiting for the waitress to stop by .  When it comes to leaving and we split the check the waitress did it all wrong and I was so done with my visit that I just payed for it and left it's bs . Honestly I payed $24.96 for crappy arrive and food . Everything could have been avoided if someone "waitress" would have informed me of that change . She told me once I got my lettuce .

I must say that I'm guilty of eating the Banzai Burger three times in a week once! It's my favorite burger there! As far as services goes... We always have a good experience there. The waiters are attentive and very polite. This is definitely the spot for my girlfriend and I if we're looking for a kick back type of night.

First time trying red robin and it was great. The whiskey burger was truly phenomenal lol. Glad Josh helped us out, beyond impressed and happy with his customer service. Will ask for him next time i'm back!!

Really good burger and fries! the meal isn't huge so you don't have to waddle out of here like you just had thanksgiving dinner. There are a lot of options and everything LOOKS AND TASTES great! The service isn't bad either, anyone working there can assist you with anything you need. I highly recommend the "Buzzard" sauce. it really adds a kick to the fries and the burger. ALSO did you know the fries are bottomless?! TRUE STORY! you finish your fries and they come by and offer you more! what else could you ask for? ...i mean a back rub wouldn't hurt but it could be awkward...
Menu was dirty along with forks they have got to do better but are waiter Danielle was super cool but place needs to clean up!!!

Food ok tasting, fries very tasty.  SERVICE SOOOO SLOW! Bottomless fries came in a metal tin with about 10 fries in it.  Each refill of fries took 15-20 min.  Waitress would not bring bigger portion and was amazingly slow.

Went to this location a couple of times. It was just ok a few times. Got a burger and a patty melt on my first few visits a couple years ago. Place is always loud.  The service, well, it usually sucks pretty bad. I'll spare the details. Upon last visit about 4 months ago, I order the fish & chips which is always really good at the Woodland Hills location. Well, this time the fish was under cooked and totally greasy. So bad the grease went into the fries. Made me sick to my stomach after the first bite. I told the waitress to just take it back and I'm not hungry I just want my money back and she said she'd have to get the manager. Well, she didn't get the manager and handed me the bill and I told her again I'm not paying for it and I had you return it. She gave me a funny look and went, "Oh, that's right. Ill get the manager." ERGH! I should have just walked out then. 10mins later, no manager or waitress to be found. So, then the bite of under cooked fish hits my stomach and I had to practically run to the bathroom. I figure after that I will go back to the table and sit down for 2 mins to finish the coke I ordered, and if no manager by then I will just leave. Anyways, on the way out of the bathroom I see the manager helping the servers at the cook station and I pull him aside and tell him the scoop. He apologizes, was very friendly but said he understands and he is totally understaffed and the cooks are not up to par today and he's had lots of complaints. He asks me who the waitress is and I tell him she never told me her name and I don't see her and I haven't seen her but 3 times the entire time. I told him I'm just leaving man and he said ok and sorry again. The waitress seemed like she was totally angry and not in a good mood to say the least. Wan't a pleasant time upon my last visit there and I told myself I won't go back ever to the Northridge mall Red Robin location ever again.  In Wooldand Hills Topanga Mall the service is hit an miss also but the food is usually consistent at least.  I dunno, whenever I've been to any Red Robins, the servers seem like they want to get you in and out of there like a fast food joint. After you pay your bill you don't see them ever again asking you if you want another drink or anything.

Came in for the soft opening (reservation only). Greated by a friendly host. Was promptly seated within 10 minutes. Was seated outside which at first I thought would be horrible because it was hot outside but the patio is well ventilated and cooled off as the sun started setting. Took our drink order , we had a speckled lemonade and some sort of berry spritzer both tasty. Ordered the wing and chips appetizer with two diffrent flavored wings (buffalo & some sort of sweet Hawaiian) both were delicious, but we had to ask for ranch. Asked a host walking by for napkins she never told anyone or brought any back... Ordered blue ribbon burger w/garlic fries, a1 peppercorn burger, bacon cheese burger no tomato (they included the tomato anyways ... not a big deal) and kids mini corn dog w/apples. One of the burgers was over cooked (medium rare was cooked medium well) other than that all the food was great. Tried the Chipotle and bacon dipping sauces and they were also very good. Split a oreo milk shake between all of us and we left full of good food and very happy. Thanks!

My friends and I came into the soft opening.  The food was amazing as well as the drinks. I will definitely be back with my friends. Service was a little slow but servers and ALL the staff where very sweet so I'm still giving a high rating. :)

And finally a well needed make over for Red Robin and great to see the staff is still the same as well as old timers back. Come see Devin at the bar he gets your order done right and makes amazing drinks and if you want to have a sit down meal to enjoy your food see the waitress Trazy.  You guys rock keep it up.

They just moved from under the parking lot to next to wood ranch  HORRIBLE FAILURE Warm beer pathetic for a brand new beer tap and my burger didn't even show up I left after waiting 40 min The two locations in the unit prior the elephant bar and the Mexican cantina were huge how they managed to make the red robin so small is beyond me. Half the size as it was when it was in the prior location. You would think it would be better it's incredibly worse  horrible service had to walk out  without eating I've been waiting so long  Failure failure failure  the only plus was the new bar has sound on the tvs unlike any other red robin so the game is on and I can hear it since the bar is separated from the rest of the small resturaunt.  What a let down get your act together pathetic

We have always enjoyed Red Robin,  but with their new location they have created a problem.  The food last night was really good and the service was excellent.  But they have designed an environment that is deliberately loud,  LOUD. TVs blast full volume from every corner. Plus there is a music trac playing. So everyone is nearly shouting at one another as they eat. Conversation was close to impossible and we could hardly wait to get out of there.  Why is noise equated to energy and linked to "fun"?

We were excited to check out the new location of this place but ended up more disappointed than anything!   We were told to wait a few extra minutes while our table was getting bussed and ready. When we were shown our table it has a disgusting amount of food under it and crawling out as well. It seriously looked like they ran out of room on the table and instead decided to dine on the floor. Instead of cleaning it up right away the hostess prompted us to sit down into the puddled up booth of whatever they decided to "clean" the seats with. DISGUSTING.  We decided to continue on anyway as our waitress Brianna was super nice. On my way to the restroom I saw about six open tables in which four of them had dirty dishes on. On my way out they were still there while someone who looked like a manager just stood around twiddling his thumb. Seriously? Is it so beneath you to maybe help clean a little bit around here? This place is filthy!

New location, where the old Elephant bar was at. I'm writing this as we've just been sat down.  Went to the restroom to wash my hands while waiting for our table to be ready. Garbage was overflowed and stalls weren't exactly the cleanest.  Unfortunately, the first thing we saw when we walked up to the table was dirty seats with crumbs everywhere and food all over underneath. Were we really suppose to step over and on the mess below?? My friends were debating on walking out and going next door to Woodranch!  Service is very friendly from the hostess and waitress. The hostess kept apologizing & had to get a napkin to wipe down the booth then ran to get a broom and dust pan to pick up the mess left behind.  They should try to at least clean everything BEFORE seating people.  We didn't even get our food yet, but now we can only imagine what we can't see in the kitchen.  Silverware is dirty as well....

While the menu and food is the same, I was so disappointed in the new decor of the new location of the restaurant.  It was hard to separate.  We had our choice of sitting in the family/screaming kids part of the restaurant or the bar area with bland tables and hightops, only, no booths. We sat in the bar area,it was okay.  The old restaurant inside the mall was so bright and vibrant.  I can only describe the new location  and decor as a cross between a hotel coffee shop and an upscale McDonalds.  So disappointing.  The food was fine, the servers served well, but, again, the decor got the best of us.  RIP Red Robin in Northridge...

We were seated on a table clearly not enough for five people. Aside from this, by the time our waiter came 20 min had passed. But, that wasn't all, our drinks, appetizers,and food came out very late and in total we spent 2hrs at this place. To keep the rest short, the food sucked, everything was overly salted and drenched in dressing... All in all disappointed and never going back.

I'm giving 2 stars, I would have given 3 but the manager Didnt feel our wait time was worth it.Had she given some discount I would have have given a 3 star manager addressed our wait issues and Mel was an outstanding waitress. We have been coming to the Northridge Red Robin for years. We have come today to the new location. We asked for a booth and it took 15 minutes for the hostess to find a busser to clean the table. There were 5 people at the hostess stand, I gather they are not allowed to help out bussing. Once the table was clean we waited for service. After 10 minutes and several waiters looking at us we asked a waiter to get the manager. She came by apologized and took our drink order.
