Mel our waitress came to us, apologized and said she wasn't aware that our table was hers, she was very sweet.    We don't like the new location. The place is choppy, rooms are everywhere (that's why Mel didn't know she was our server) LOUD  and way too bright. It's sensory overload.  My husband and I are leaving with headaches and we probably won't be back anytime soon.

All i have to say is LOL. How do you move to a new location and are worse than ever. Absolutely terrible. I guess that building is a jinx,nothing ever works out over there. Hopefully this shuts down faster than elephant bar and they open a good sports bar.

This was the worst experience. We took our friend out to lunch for her birthday we let our server know we only had an hour lunch he said no problem we ordered our drinks an food promptly to speed up the process, well we sat there for an hour and 10 min. No food the waiter never came to see if we needed drink refills nor could we find him to inquire about our food. We finally had to tell them to box the food because we had to leave we were already late. When we unpacked the food we realized the orders were wrong the fries were crunchy like tostadas and stale, we were not provided with utensils and or paper towels some of the orders were missing items. Ridiculous service. We did get a discount for our food taking so long but we would have preferred our food be good and the service more efficient. We will never go back.

Upgrade in location downgrade in service!  Went in for dinner on a weeknight, we were happy to try out the new location!  First, we were seated ...waited and waited finally had to ask for our server.  The meal arrived but we were never brought utensils or napkins! So we waited again, my husband and daughter ordered  dishes vs burgers/finger foods, the utensils were essential. The server didn't really check on us, when she did we asked for refills and waited!!  My husband became a bit irritated and he's a chill person. He said "Upgrade in location downgrade in service", he's right!

Terrible move. The seating is cramped. The service is super slow. The place is clearly not well managed. I say this with over a decade of restaurant management experience. Waited 9.minutes for a table at 1:30 on a Saturday but 20 minutes for our drinks and over 40 minutes for food. A waitress tried to squeeze through with high chairs but the space is so tight she had to lift them over a guest's head and make him duck. Um, go around? Reading all the complaints on here says a lot. Kids food portions seems smaller. All servings of fries were smaller and barely seasoned, though we were offered a refill on them. Server Mel was friendly and nice.  Earned an extra star, otherwise this would be a one star review.  Won't be back.

This red robin is dangerous. Since they opened their new location, it has become a bar and grill atmosphere with bar fights and poor service. It probably isn't safe to bring your kids there. On my last two occasions there, I clearly explained to the waiter and waitress what I wanted, repeated it several times to make sure it was what and how I wanted and they got it wrong on both occasions. Lack of training, lack of listening, lack of caring about your cxustomers, the food is decent but not at the risk of getting hurt in a bar fight or waiting forever to get the correct food that you ordered.

Looking forward to trying the new location because we always loved the old one.  I admit it was a Saturday night, which may have contributed to the noise level but what were they thinking when they chose battleship gray for the walls and a totally squared out design in the "dining room"?  It looked like a prison.  It was a LOUD prison.  As I went to the desk to remove our name from the list, they offered a table outside.  That we could do.  Service was cool as always.  The food is excellent but the initial fries are much smaller than they used to be and the whole burger comes plopped on plastic plate.  Long gone are the baskets and the individual waxed paper that gave some semblance of cleanliness.  The one plus was that the drink refills came out much more quickly than in the old location but it wasn't enough to outweigh the soulless nightmare inside.  We won't be back.

New location is nice food still good but the service is terrible.  Seated quickly but after 15 minutes with no server I had to go ask for someone .  Waited another 5 minutes before someone showed up. Our order came out in a timely manner but then getting the check took another 15/20 minutes.  Not impressed with the service here .

We were very satisfied with the exceptional customer service by our waiter Adam. He was genuinely friendly, prompt, and catered to us when we needed it. We were never waiting on him, he was waiting on us. Food was good too. Nice new location at the Northridge Mall

Red Robin's is one of my all time favorite places to buy a Burger. My favorite burger is the Bison burger or the Red Robin burger with bottomless steak fries. I love the ice tea varieties as my drink. Highly recommended burger spot!!!! Yum !!!!

I was interested in trying out the new location.  I like that it has a street entrance now and outdoor seating. That's about all I liked.  The decor is not as classy as the old location. It looks like it is geared to a younger demographic. ..like 7 year olds!. The seating is crowded and cramped! It felt like we were sitting on top of our neighbors and vice versa. It had more of a cafeteria feel to it. The service was slow.  My husband ordered soup and it came out with his meal.  There was plenty of time for it to come out sooner. After our food was delivered,  we had to ask for utensils, napkins, and condiments. The food was decent, but all the screaming kids  .... made it so we couldn't leave fast enough. There lacked a sense of intimacy that most restaurants have. ..and it was not enjoyable. 2 stars for street entrance and decent food...otherwise thumbs down!

Food was average, service was poor. Went with a friend who used to work there. Took a long time, they forgot his order , then when they tried to correct it the forgot that  , it was just a disaster. My friend started talking to one of the old waiters who worked there, this old  guy turns to my friend and says "Is this your mom ? " I start laughing as he and I look nothing alike :)  Total weirdoville. Told them to split the bill. Gave them his money and my card, they charged everything on my card. Had to wait ten minutes while they took the money back off my card. MMmm no. A mess from beginning to end.

I was excited to have lunch here yesterday to see the RR resto they moved from inside to a bigger place outside the mall.  Re-opened on Oct 14.    The new place is a lot bigger compared to the one in the mall. Interior is avant garde and perfect marriage of colors and designs. A lot less confining. On this visit I ordered the Uberburger, really tasty  and juicy. I have to say RR does make really good burgers. Now, I usually order my burger with the bottomless root beer float and have them bring me a plate of crispy beefsteak  fries for starters. You may wonder why only 3 stars?  Here goes, Rosie introduced herself as our waitress. So we went ahead and ordered. After 15 minutes another girl comes along and gave me a plate of stale fries, which I had to return. Then after another 10 mins, a guy brings me a glass with ice cream, it took him another 5 min to bring a glass of flat root beer. Now the ice cream is melted and root beer at room temp. That does not make it a refreshing float. I didn't return it anymore because of my rapid hypoglycemia.  It took then another 20 mins, finally Rosie appears to bring my burger.  Lastly, I had to ask for utensils and napkins. Wasn't that supposed to come first? At least with the burger I have no complaints. Once we're done eating a plate of over crispy fries arrives. You kidding me? In the occasion of my birthday I got an ice cream sundae, which didn't bring splashes of sunshine on this day.   I had to ask Rosie if everybody was new at this branch, because I do not see any familiar servers. Rosie said some are but most are old. Beffuddling because, it really felt like they were still on a dry run.  I still have to thank them though for my free birthday burger. Hence in average 3 stars, good burger yes, but less than satisfactory service. Hopefully, it will get better because I do enjoy their burgers, sadly not a place for desserts.

Terrible service I use to love the service and food but clearly the service has downgraded. The location has not been for the best the seating is cramped. Very sad to be let down this way as a customer of what was once a great restaurant

First, the place was spotless and modern, i don't agree with the other reviews.  the Smoke N Pepper burger was nice!!! and the pickled spears ARE TO DIE FOR!!!! to top of off our server Jackie was quick, on top of it, and professional. I recommend u request her.. and tip her right! good experience!!
I am so very frustrated with the service at this location. Our food came wrong multiple times. They forgot to bring my kids drinks and more fries. For a family friendly place- my family is NOT happy.

Came to Red Robbin with a friend it's a new bigger location in Northridge. I was really happy to see a lettuce wrapped burger option and I swapped the fries for the steamed broccoli.  For appetizers my friend got the onion rings tower she loved it.  I got hummus and carrots and my kid loved it and it's a super healthy option to chips and salsa All in all its a very American style diner happy to see healthy options

I went on Saturday to try out the bar area. Service is good, servers are nice. Appetizers were delicious. It's happy hour all day on a Saturday? Awesome. Just added another place to the weekend happy hour list

For a gourmet burger place, I was pretty underwhelmed.  First off, the rarest they cook their burgers is medium which made me weary. Second, service was mediocre and slow despite not being very busy when I was there. I had their Bleu Ribbon burger which was good when I was able to get bite of bleu cheese with the patty but not so when I didn't. The Garlic Herb Fries were also underwhelming and tasted overseasoned. There are plenty of other great places to eat at the Northridge mall, so it's unlikely I'll be back here.

location: Lake View Terrace, Los Angeles, CA
review: So I went here because I wanted a decent tasting burger with my friend because we had an hour lunch (we notified the waiter),we were seating quickly which was great and we already knew what we wanted to order so it didn't take us long to figure out what to eat. We placed our ordered it was a wrap, tortilla soup and a burger. The people that were seated after us got their food before I even got my soup. It took 30min to get my soup, and not even once did the waiter come and refill my drink or come and check in. We realized 45min later that were weren't going to get our food on time, so we got up and went to speak to a manager to get charged for the soup. Once we found the manager, the waiter ran up all concerned; when he didn't bother checking in for the past 45min. The manager didn't charge me for the soup and we just left. Overall it was a horrible lunch experience especially when other people that ordered after you got their food before you.

We just left this location after waiting nearly 40 minutes in total for service.  The hostess had to fetch our drinks which I didn't mind but we were starving with my family being with me and I was looking forward to eating here. I preferred the old location inside the mall, a lot bigger and on point with service.  Won't be coming here anymore.

This use to be in the mall downstairs now it has taken over where elephant bar used to be. The burgers are amazing and endless fries. The service is also good I went on a Friday and it was packed, still great service.

Horrible service! Took forever to get our food. Which was not very good! Server messed up our order and brought us a well done beef burger ( and we ordered chicken- we don't eat beef!) Took forever to get our check!!! Never coming back here.

New location. Located right outside in the mall parking. My review is for the bar portion of the restaurant. Food is good. Staff are friendly. Just wished they'd have a better happy hour. Not really a fan of domestic beers, so that doesn't benefit me. Red Robin needs to step up their Happy Hour beer selection. Especially if other nearby locations offer a better selection for happy hour beers. No major complaints from me here. I do like the new location. Especially the bar area.

I'd rather give this location negative stars. The service is horrible. I'm here on Veterans Day, ordered a Double Tavern Burger, and someone next to me at the bar got the same thing. Let me add that he sat down 10 minutes after me. I didn't get my food until 15 minutes after dude got his. The service here is pathetic. When I asked about my order, the staff gave me lame excuses. I think moving from inside Northridge Mall to outside was a huge mistake. I'm never going to this location ever again. I'll try the Westfield Topanga Mall location. Horrible horrible horrible!!!!!

Host forgot my food. Came to our table and asked if we were ready for our check. when I told him I was still waiting for my food he went to the kitchen for 10 minutes only to return to with my side and to say it will be 30 minutes after I have already waited 40 minutes. Worst service ever very unhappy just canceled my order as my family had finished there food. Not one time did he apologize for his mistake.

Eh... not really crazy about this place. Service was good but the food wasn't really anything to write home about. So many different types of burgers and I'm sure one of them will satisfy your taste buds for the evening. They have a several different types of beers on top and flat screen TV's to catch a sporting event. Won't go out of my way to eat there but would probably pop in for a burger if im in the area.

I like the new location, Red Robin. I came here last night with my best friend for dinner. The wait was only about 10 min after they told us it would be 15-20 min.  They gave us a half booth and a half table which I didn't mind. What I do mind is how small the table is. There are a little too many things on it that we didn't even use and put everything to the side so that we could see each other.  Anyway after that only con, everything else was positive. The servers were very attentive and kind and happy. We ordered appetizers: Red's Bold Boneless Wings with Buffalo sauce (not spicy for me which I like!) and the Creamy Artichoke and Spinach Dip. Both appetizers were delicious, only thing I can mention to make it better - give us more dip =) it was too yummy.  I ordered the chocolate oreo milkshake and my friend ordered a cider beer (which i forget the name of). My milkshake was very yummy and my friend enjoyed her beverage as well. Now our entrees. I ordered the Clucks and fries and my friend ordered the Guacamole Bacon burger. We both enjoyed our meals very much (I'm a big fan of strips and if those are good the place is good).  This has been the second time I have been to Red Robin, first at the old location inside the mall and the first time at this new location still located at the mall but outside next to Woodranch.  The place was neat and clean, the staff is friendly, the wait was short, the place is louder than it used to be but it's not so loud that it's annoying, my friend and I could still hold up a conversation. I will come here again to show my boyfriend how much I liked it.  Thanks Red Robin for making it such a nice experience.

I was there today with my hungry husband. We ordered the burgers and both of them were terrible because they were dry and tasteless even though it was their 'gourmet' meat. Meat was very greasy. The aftertaste was like swallowing a hair ball and then trying to throw it back up. We both ate less than half of our burgers. And the fruit salad was obviously not fresh at all. The fruit salad looked like a heavy set sweaty brick layer grabbed a bunch of fruit from a jar that has been on the shelf since Wednesday 2008 and slapped it on to the dish. The service was really good. Our hostess and waitress were very active and pleasant. They get the star.

The problem with Red Robin is that they say they have gourmet burgers, but they don't. They have some specialty toppings and a bit of a creative menu, but they're not gourmet. The burgers are average. Run of the mill. They've got to step it up on the burger patty to even approach gourmet.  We ordered a Keep it Simple Burger with grilled onions, a Black and Bleu Burger, and kids chicken tenders. We also ordered the garlic aioli for dipping the fries. If you've got to eat, the burgers are fine, but no better than average. The garlic aioli was no good.  The service was friendly. Both the hostess and waitress were genuine. We did not wait too long for our food.  I don't like the decor much. I like the kitsch in the old restaurant, the miniature Statue of Liberty, a ton of fun posters on the walls, merry-go-round horse, etc. These items often even became part of our dinner conversation. Now it's boring, nothing much to look at. The lights are wrapped in paper. The tables are too close together. We could use some good restaurants here in Northridge. I can't say this is going to be one of them. I'd sooner pick Yard House or Claim Jumpers just a few steps away.
Everytime if been to these location it has been nothing but excellent service A bit of more tvs would be good though last couple of times have sat near no tvs

Quick service, great service. Our server was Matt and he was super nice and patient! He convinced us to try the chicken burger and I've never had a chicken burger here before, I'm usually a beef patty person but I gave it a try and I enjoyed the recommendation! He attended to us very well! Thanks Matt!

Since RR moved to it's new location the place is in chaos.  Everything seems unorganized and they do not seem to care.  Recently our family visited and were seated at a table.  When we saw a booth open nearby, we asked if we could move.  We were told we would have to get back in the que and wait.  Totally unacceptable and we will not be returning.
Second time here. Pricey for diner food. Servers should not walk around with their ass hanging out. Made me lose my appetite. Orders not right either.
Great food. Friendly staff. Always clean. Love where it's now located and how they decorated. Come here at least once a week now.

I'm a frequent Red Robin customer.. Went to the new Northridge location. Awesome layout. Wanted to give credit to the bartender for an awesome hospitality. Sorry I don't remember your name but you had a great sweater. You had a Gremlin Christmas sweater with Gizmo on it. You are good to go sir.

I went there with a friend shortly after they moved from their old location near See's candy to the new location closer to the north side of the mall.  The service was terrible.  Whoever took our order (I think a manager, not a regular waitress) forgot to bring our food to us.  They also let us sit with empty drinks.   It was not crowded or busy.  Empty tables all around.  Waiters often walked by and noticed us, but said nothing.   When we finally asked someone about our food (like 30 + minutes later), the manager person who took our order came over and acted like nothing was wrong.  Then she brought us cold food that had obviously been sitting a while.  The sauces already had a kind of coagulated top film from sitting so long.  When we said it was cold and we couldn't eat it, she didn't say a word.  She just picked it up and left.  I don't know what she planned to do, but I wasn't going to wait around to find out.   We walked around the corner and had a great experience at CPK.  Red Robin was good at the old location across from See's Candy, but not so great after the move.  Maybe just growing pains in the new location, but I'll wait a while before I go back and try again.

12/29/15 Hello Puke Central (literally) Should be no star. We started with a 2 star until my hubby was throwing up most of the night. Any place that has this repercussion warrants no more visits and should receive no stars at all. Around 2am he gets the cold sweats, mind you the food had sent us both begging for a restroom after having eaten there. Then around 2:30am it was time to hug the porcelain whale for about an hour. You can remodel all you like but the food is sub-par and given the ramifications we are definitely out.  12/28/15 2 Star The service was great. Our server Marina was awesome and on top of her game (kudos to Marina). As for the food, meh. The onion soup was way too salty. The coffee tasted almost like metal, and the burgers, well sent us to restroom a little quicker than usual. We will leave it at that. The food is mediocre at best and for these reasons we will not be coming back. The new location is nice but the food hasn't improved by all that much.

Host was nice, bar tender was cool... server, not sure, they never came. Or actually she walked right by about 7 times and didn't say a word to us. We had to ask the host if we had to order from the bar.  Maybe 25 min later the host brought us menus and the bar tender had to be our server. Matt, the bar tender was really cool. Michelle, the "server", never spoke a word to us. I really dont know what we did. But I hope the manager handles that. Because red robin won't be my suggestion anymore.  It would be 1 star if it weren't for matt
I love their Garden burger and sweet potato fries. My husband and I go about once per month and sit at the bar and enjoy a burger, and some conversation.

First if all, I like that this got moved to a bigger and more accessible location,  near other restautants.  It is Saturday afternoon,  there's a 20 minute wait. Party of 1 with toddler was seated by Joshua, very friendly and able to get highchair as requested. Our order: guac salsa chips, cheese sandwich bites, cup of tortilla soup, red Robin gourmet burger, kids milk. Note: portions look smaller but overall had a good meal. Food wise I would give 3.5 but I do notice the team here works together from servers to managers, so that says something. Marina was our main server,  was fast and helpful in showing me how to use electronic menu. I also like it that they have a reward loyalty program.

I don't know what complainers are complaining about. Maybe they didn't like the whole "move" from 1 wing of the mall to another. I came here last week craving a burger. Of course, like most people's new years resolutions, eat more healthy. I ordered a crispy chicken sandwich (yeah, I know, fried chicken, throwing health out the window), on a wheat bun and opted for the side salad with balsamic vinaigrette. The good thing? The side salad option is bottomless, just like the fries! Everything tasted great and came promptly on time. No issues here. Will be back... Although, I do miss the whole retro look.

This is one of the nicest Red Robins I've ever been too. I was really surprised when I walked in. I guess they're going for a classier look than the memorabilia covered walls of other locations. And you know what, I think it's a great decision! Food was good as usual. My burger bun was a little soft so it soaked up juices & got a bit mushy by the end of the meal, but oh well. My wife had also ordered a 2nd round of her fries, but we waited too long and she got full. By the time we paid, the waitress just never came back. And that was another weird thing. We had about 3-4 different people serve or take our orders from the minute we came in. 1 to take an appetizer order, 1 to bring it, 1 to take our drink and main meal order, & another to bring it to us. Maybe it's an efficiency move for the restaurant, but it just felt weird never knowing who was going to show up.  In all, I'll definitely come back to this location. I'll just prepare myself for the little kinks we experienced this time around. Hopefully they'll be gone the 2nd time around.

Please do not waste your time coming to this restaurant. First off it took 15 minutes to get a waiter/waitress at our table. Secondly, they got all 4 of my family members orders mixed up. Thirdly, when asked for the manager, she didn't come over for a good 30 minutes AND rolled her eyes as she walked away when told about our problems. This restaurant is VERY unorganized and unprofessional. The service SUCKS the manager is RUDE AND SUCKS. Her name is Joann. So if you see her walk right out the door because your service will be terrible. It had nothing to do with the money or us trying to get a free meal either for complaining because we ALL had GIFT CARDS. I went on 1/10/16 so this is very recent. VERY DISAPPOINTED. I will never go to this Red Robin ever again I do not recommend this place to anyone.

I don't know what these people are talking about with their 1 or 2 stars, but I've been to this location about 5 times since it's opened, and it hasn't dissapointed since! The servers are always super nice and friendly and always check up on my boyfriend and I every chance they get. The wait time on any given night has been at most 20-25 minutes, and at the least was about 5 minutes. It all depends on what day you go on. To the people who complain about the wait time: what were you expecting if you go on a Friday night, the busiest night of the week? Anyways, I love how they've revamped Red Robin over the years and include many new items on the menu. My personal favorite is the Royal Red Robin (burger with an egg on it). Considering this place is famous for its burgers, burgers are pretty much all I get. Can't say anything about the other items like fish and chips, but if you're craving a bomb a** burger, make this your go-to place! Also, try the campfire sauce with everything! It makes fries and burgers absolutely AMAZING!

This is my kids favorite restaurant so we end up here 2-3 times per month. They have recently moved locations for a larger space outside the mall. It is a great place to bring children without having to worry about how loud it gets. They offer a full bar and an OK selection of beer. It is a shame in Los Angeles that any restaurant does not tap into local craft brewers and I rate it as a miss for Red Robin. They could do much better in this area, which is why it is a 4 star rating. The burgers are above average and with multiple offerings to please any palate. I like the fact they roll promotions frequently that allows new tastes to come in and out. The kids menu has many choices as well to please the pickiness kids can have, but what about my craft beer for the beer snob pickiness. Ok, ok it's not about the beer :) wait yes it is, Red Robin get better craft beers! I am always satisfied with the food and if not feeling a burger I go for the wedge and a bowl of chili. You know what goes good with chili? Craft beer :) last time I promise. We will be back and enjoy this location frequently. Red Robin thank you for being my kids favorite.

My first time to this location. The decor is anything like the old Red Robin it makes you feel like your eating in a cafeteria. The service was awful! My friend and I waited a long time before are waitress came to our table. And we waited almost 1/2 hour for our meal. I definitely will not be returning to this Red Robin.

I've always liked red robin but yesterday got food poisoning from here had fish and chips the fish was weird almost inedible an the frys  were like 2 day old it was a terrible experience will not be back

This was my first time here and I'd have to say that I wasn't very pleased with the Red Robins here.  At first, everything was alright but while we were making our order, we asked one question and the server already looked annoyed. It seemed like she had no patience for us. She's also not very attentive. We had to wait maybe like 10-15 minutes for her every time we needed something.  Then for the food, it was pretty good but my fries were room temperature.  Overall it was a whatever experience.
Super slow ass service for some cold food. They messed up our order.  The food took forever.  The food was mediocre after waiting a long time.

My first time at Red Robin a week ago, and it started off pretty well. I enjoyed the atmosphere, the colors, the designs on the walls, etc. The food itself was very good, the gourmet burgers especially.  However, one thing that this Red Robin lacked very much was good service. Our server was simply not there when we needed him. We barely saw him, he did not check on us, and we always needed to flag him down to get something. Not only that, but the orders were mixed up as well. We ordered garlic fries twice and got original both times, and we had to ask for bbq sauce and ranch several times before actually getting it. We also ordered our gourmet burger done medium rare, but they all came in well done. But the manager did indeed come to the rescue and was extremely kind. He apologized for the orders and got them fixed as soon as he could. He came back with them, asked how it was, and then a couple minutes later he came in to check if we needed anything else and if everything turned out alright.  I am definitely coming back for the food at Red Robin, but maybe not this particular one any time soon.

Went last night and it wasn't that crowded so I'm curious why the service was so bad.  We waited quite awhile for our food.  Once they brought our food, my sons immediately ask for more "bottomless fries". The server finally came back with one order of fries for my two sons!  So they again asked for more fries which came when they were already finished with their burgers. We also had to flag someone down to get our obviously empty cups refilled. Their food may be good but they need to work on their service! Why do they advertise "bottomless fries" when they're so stingy with it?

I've always loved Red Robin. I've had plenty of positive experiences.. But unfortunately, yesterday just wasn't a nice experience. The old Northridge location across from See's Candy was so much more home-y and nicer with nice dim lighting. This new one by WoodRanch just has a Denny's Vibe.  The walls are bland with just random decorations trying to hide the bland mess.  As for service, the hostesses had a really superficial smile. You can tell when a smile is real and fake. The waitress was really nice and sweet though so that's what got at least two stars. She had to leave unfortunately due to her shift ending halfway in so we tipped her. The waiter that took care of us afterward though... We even requested the server through the app that they have on the tablets, and he didn't come to us seven minutes later despite him walking past us twice and clearly noticing that the tablet was flashing red.. Manager was nice and attentive too.
Large party on a busy Sunday...We got great service, tasty lettuce wrapped burgers and a fun dinning experience. I love the new updated location.

Preferred the original location felt more like a neighborhood restaurant with killer ambience, mood lighting, and service. The vibe of the new place is a little unsure but the staff is more than friendly. Had a great experience on valentine's day food made just right, drinks refreshing, mood romantic on the outside patio. Unfortunately sitting inside was a little unbearable - the ac was busted and the place felt like a sauna (granted I know this isn't their usually room temp), but to top it off we had to wait and extra 15 minutes just to be set outside even though we were told we'd have a shorter wait time. I still had a good night and great service however the few hiccups at this new location seem to be on going: running out of or low on avocado, beer, etc. Definitely worth checking out... will update my review after my next visit.

Visually, this is not one of your typical Red Robin locations.  The decor is a bit different and I kind of miss the traditional look.   It looks like someone was trying to save some money, but I'm not an interior decorator and it didn't impact my experience on iota . . . so c'est la vie! They were very busy when we arrived, but we got seated in the time frame they estimated for us and we were happy. The food was great, however they were slow to replenish drinks and refills on fries were very hard to come by.  Part of the reason might be that they use a tag team approach for serving customers.  We had three or four different servers take our requests and/or bring our items.  I suppose they view it as being efficient, and maybe it is when it is executed correctly, but it came across like tag team night at a WWF event. Here is a ratings breakdown, for everyone who reads the ending before the story: Food: 4+ stars Service: 2+ stars Experience: 3 stars

They need to change the veggie patty it is awful.  Dennys has a really good one.  But the one at red robins is grey and tastes horrible.  Their drinks are way too sweet for my taste! I do love their fries!!

This was probably the worst burger I've ever eaten. I ordered the beef pink and it was cooked like shoe leather. I was with a group and the waiter offered to replace it for me. I said no so I wouldn't hold up the rest of our group to wait while I ate. I asked for some blue cheese spread to help moisten the burger and he brought it after I put ketchup on it and ate it. The rest of our group had finished their meals before the waiter finally brought it.  There's nothing worse than ketchup on blue cheese but I did it to see if it would help make it a little moist.  The manager came by to see if we enjoyed our meals. I explained what happened and she said she was sorry. It would of been nice if she had offered me a scoop of ice cream or maybe not charge me for the disgusting meal. This is my first YELP review but I felt the need to warn anyone who wants to go there "DON'T DO IT".

I was looking forward to giving this RR a shot.  I brought my son and niece for dinner the other night.  We sat down at a somewhat "dirty" table.  Kinda sticky.  We ordered.  The waitress was really nice.  Drinks came quickly.  Food came without silverware or napkins (they weren't on the table when we sat down).  Made our silveware/napkin request.  The kids started eating, but I waited for my silverware to cut my burger.  I waited and waited (10MIN+).  Napkins finally came.  Then, we were told the silverware was being washed, so we'd have to wait for it.   I decided to bite into my (Garden) burger as to not wait anymore.  At this point it was kinda cold~not sure if it was the temperature or not, but the burger was just not so good.  Nobody around to send it back to be heated.  The silverware never came.  I ate about 4 bites of burger and left the rest.  When the waitress finally came she asked if I wanted to take my burger to go.  I explained that I didn't really like it, and then explained that it had gotten cold while I was waiting for a knife (which I still hadn't received).  She just said, "I'm sorry."  I paid the bill via the table-top computer pay/game station.  I tipped 15%.  My son and niece encouraged me to speak up and say something to management...gotta love those teens.  On the way out I spoke to a manager who offered me a RR gift card to make up for my bad experience.  I explained I would not be coming back.  I showed her a picture of my uneaten $9+ burger.  She again offered the giftcard.  I asked for a refund of my burger since it was uneaten.  She had to "go in the back" to ask someone if she could do that.  I waited and waited and waited.  I almost left.  Finally she came back and said she would refund my credit card for the amount of the burger.  It would take 10 days to see the refund.  I agreed.  Personally, I think they should have covered the whole bill.  No silverware???  Are you kidding me???  Never returning.  Want a burger in Northridge at a restaurant?  You're better off at Islands.  You're even more better off at The Habit.

Food was good: got the Guacamole, Red Robin Royal, and Banzai burgers with bottomless fries. Only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because of the ridiculously horrible service.  Our server waited on 4 other tables several times over a span of 25 minutes and didn't visit our table once. We had to use the call waiter button but still did not receive service from our waiter. Had to wait ~5 minutes before another waiter finally waited on us. Plus, overall feel of the workers just wasn't welcoming... Only coming back because of bottomless fries.

I used to like red Robin! Told my wife lets  give it another chance so we did. i just don't learn. It literally took 20minutes for someone to come over Place was not busy at all time was 1:30pm it is now 3:15 my wife ordered cob salad so did i, my son ordered kids pizza, and our friends son ordered a plain hamburger. Food took forever to come finally came! Little guys pizza tasted like cardboard, and hamburger came as a cheeseburger, sent it back took longer than the first time in round one. salads where okay not like they used to be. Just to add my sons chocolate milk came with all the chocolate at the bottom!! Just to add.   Sincerely Not so happy

I miss the old location across from See's. It used to be comfy with a few of my favorites. I've tried the new location three times and I have no plans to return. This new place is cramped and uncomfortable. The food is not prepared as well as before. In particular, the fries have been tough as if they are frying them ahead of time and letting them sit. I wish they would've made this location a "red robin pub" and left the old location open.
It's good but not my type of place, I do enjoy there onion rings! It's a good place for family and it's clean and neat. I do recommend this place to burger lovers!

This place needs a lot of work. Everything took a long time, and the waitress forgets the requests. We had to ask for basic stuff like napkins, and the beer menu is not representative of what they have on tap. It's like they are holding out the good beers from me or something. Burger was ok, a bit mediocre for a$11 burger, but the fries were wilted.

Finally I got to try out this RR and to be honest, I was not too thrilled about the food. But let me say this, the hostess, "Jodi" was amazingly friendly and cheerful. She recommended the Ramen burger which we ended up ordering.  The atmosphere and the ambiance was not bad. If you like to watch TV, they have quite few of them all around the place. Nice small bar where you can have you food and booze while watching some of the sports they are showing.  SERVICE**** I have to say that the service was kind of slow at the beginning. They had this tablet at the table and we were wondering if we were suppose to use it to place our order or not. We decided to try it out, we choose one item but we were unable to order. So the tablet is used as a menu I guess or maybe its activated in different time than the lunch time.  We flagged the waitress "Jackie or Jacqueline" am not sure of the name, she was rushing and told us give me a minute please. Few minutes later she came back and apologized, then she took our order. I will say she was attentive to our needs although she was kind of rushing and that is not her fault am sure, I think they were understaffed and that is a management problem that slows down service and full attention to customers. I also notice the bartender who seems to be taking orders from the bar and somewhere else. This guy was a hustler, he was running back and forth none stop trying to take care or bills and other things. Thumbs up to him.  THE FOOD*** We ordered as follow: ===Appetizer===Creamy Artichoke & Spinach Dip and for the price of $7 it was just OK, nothing that wowed us. ===Red Robin's Finest Burger=== Ciabatta bun with double beef, bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese and egg for around the $15 dollars with all the fries you can eat.  We ordered this to be cooked medium rare and it came cooked almost medium well. It really lacked the taste and flavor, dry, and the fried egg came already with the egg yolk busted and all over the plate. At the end, I told the waitress it was not cooked as requested, she replied " but you ate it all" oh yeah we ate it all cause we were hungry and not welling to wait any longer for it to be ordered again. This was not a winner hamburger at all. You can agree or disagree but that is my personal opinion.  ===Ramen Burger===This is what the hostess Jodi recommended. Crispy Ramen noodles shaped as a bun, thick piece of beef patty with lettuce, tomatoes and cheese, ordered medium. I have to say this was really delicious. We loved the crunchiness of the Ramen noodles. The beef was cooked as ordered but still lacked the flavor.  I would say that I would not be running to have a hamburger at RR anytime soon. There are other burger joints that serve a much better burger and for less.

The new location is nice. Elegant and bigger.  The food is really good. Bottomless fries and I love the freckled lemonade .

The food was okay. Bottomless fries is always good. The waiter was nice and I was going to tip him well, but he automatically tipped himself 20% when he was showing us how to pay the bill using the touch screen. Not cool man.
Food was fast and delicious ,server was fastand attentive  came in before work keep it up guy working at the bar never got his name :)
excellent food excellent service highly recommended david joseph hall

Red robin is my favorite restaurant . Especially this location . The staff is super friendly and veteran to your needs the food always comes in a great timely matter . The plus side to this place is the parking lot is very ope with plenty of spaces and the bathrooms are always clean!

Red robin was one of my family's favorite spot to eat when visiting northridge mall now it's moved to a different location and I completely hate it. Red Robin was a unique location and has been made over to a cheap 2nd class Dennys with horrible trickets and cheap look.  This rating is completely on the new look and vibe. Idiot CEO'S putting there BS vision on a great diner to a hand me down Denny's
Yes it's bottomless fries, but I actually saw the bottom, our waitress should have been more attentive. Other than that, good place for burgers, very roomy, not too crowded.

As several yelpers have mentioned this location looks different from other Red Robin branches. This is because for a brief time this was Elephant Bar. They filed Bankruptcy and apparently left  all the tables and fixtures behind when they closed this location. Red Robin changed little or nothing when they moved in. Personally I like this easy to access location at the mall's north end. The hostess directed me to the bar area for immediate seating as the dining room had several people waiting to be seated. I found a high-top table and took a seat. I looked at the menu and decided on the Smoke and Pepper burger with garlic herb fries.  The garlic herb fries were tasty but had more melted parmesan than garlic or herbs. The burger was excellent. The pepper was subtle enough so it didn't overpower the other flavors of the burger. The large patty was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The service was fine and I enjoyed playing the trivia game on the mini-tablet on the table (won every game!).
On a Friday night, party of 9, we had to wait almost two hours to get a table and our food. Definitely not worth it.

Love Red Robin! Burgers and bottomless fries! YUMM! I tried the Tavern Double with mushrooms.  Very good.  Never disappointed.  I like sitting in the bar. Great service from an exceptional bartender.  Try to come by early on weekdays. Love my Red Robin!
There was a waiter name Adam. He was very friendly and nice. He is a guy who you connect with. I recommend him.

I like red robin. But I will not be going back to this one again. There were multipul issues with my food. I had to send the salad back twice due to getting a ceaser salad when I order a house salad, and my burger came without cheese, even though sharp cheader cheese is one of the ingredients tat makes the burger stand out from the others. It also came with grilled onions instead of crispy onions. The watier brought back my burger with a microwaved slice of tasteless cheese melted on top. The burger was overcooked. Most likley due to being microwaved to quickly melt the cheese on it. There were other issues with my burger as well. I took a few bites and got a to go box because it was going to be free anyway, or so I thought, because I had a birthday burger coupon.  Then i find out that because there is a 20 percent off coupon on my card i can not use my coupon for the free burger, i have to use the other one. I ask to speak with the manager who just kept repeating that there was nothing she could do  regardless of the issues with my food. She was very cold and firm with extreamly poor customer service skills. I have no issue with the waiter, he was nice and just doing his job. He said he explained the concerns with the food to the manager. It left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively. Hopefully I will have a better experience at the woodland hills red robin.

Red robin has definitely grown on me the past couple of months..have gone plenty of times but till now I am really appreciating this spot..have tried the chili burger before and I really enjoyed it..my go to burger is the fried egg with an extra patty...boy does that extra patty make the burger more delicious and you get bottomless fries take my money now!! I upgraded to the chili cheese fries which are not unlimited but that's what I wanted..could be more generous on the chili fries don't really give u a huge portion..paired my burger with stone IPA which is one of my go to IPA's..great job red robin keep up the good work..
Food: buffalo wings were really salty. The burger was meh. I can make that quality burger.

Finally! A bar I could come get a drink without all the shady drunkies. Each time I come here I always go to their bar. I've been fairly lucky that my bar tender has mostly been Jacklyn (I hope that's how you spell her name). My experience with her has been nothing short from phenomenal. She always finds good drinks to recommend me when I can't decide and she always maintains a nice friendly conversation. Aside from her service this location is really good. I've tried basically everything their menu and I can't seem to decide what I like more. The service is quick and place is practically spotless considering how busy they get. I will definitely recommend anyone to come here

If you're without kids, sit in the bar. There are always tables available, and its quieter than the dining area. Marina is was our server again. She's quick, funny, and efficient. She's the reason my wife and I come here. Oh I almost forgot,  the foods pretty good too.
Best red robins in the valley. They have good costumer service and the food is good . Nothing special Just good burgers. Its better than any in n out or carls

There was a GIANT ROACH ON THE FLOOR... When we got to our booth. The server/manager tried to play it off, stepped on it and then as he lifted his foot, it fell.
